nodes.text: The Kalki Nebula was a treacherous Outer Rim Territories nebula located in the Cassander sector. Long before 3643 BBY, a frigate became adrift in the nebula. When the unresponsive starship emerged from the nebula around that year, an individual boarded it and recovered its navigational data as well as some of its cargo. The Kalki Nebula later became a part of the Tendrannan sector of the Galactic Empire.

The Kalki Nebula was a treacherous nebula that constituted a part of the star cluster that eventually became the Tendrannan sector, a subsector of the Cassander sector in the New Territories portion of the Outer Rim Territories. The nebula shared its name with two astronomical objects in the Garqi system: the planet Kalki and the asteroid field known as Kalki's Braid.

Long before the struggle between the Galactic Republic and the reconstituted Sith Empire, a frigate with cargo aboard became adrift in the Kalki Nebula. Around 3643 BBY, the frigate, unresponsive yet well-preserved by vacuum, emerged from the nebula.

Shortly after the starship's emergence, an individual affiliated with one of the factions in the ongoing Republic–Sith Empire conflict dispatched a companion to board the vessel, which appeared to be a trading ship. The companion subsequently recovered the frigate's navigation logs and some of its preserved cargo.

When the Galactic Empire later divided the domain known as the Cassandran Worlds into subsectors, the Kalki Nebula and the parsecs of half-explored space surrounding it became a part of the Tendrannan sector. The Kalki Nebula subsequently was situated in the territory of the Pentastar Alignment between 4 ABY and 12 ABY and fell within the borders of the Imperial Remnant between 12 ABY and 13 ABY.
The Kalki Nebula was first mentioned in the 2004 Wizards of the Coast sourcebook Geonosis and the Outer Rim Worlds. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas placed it in grid square L-5.
